sections.title: Welcome to Your Award Guide
sections.content: Let's explore the Building and Construction General On-site Award together. This quick guide will help you understand your rights and responsibilities in just a few minutes.
key_points: Key points highlighted for easy reference

quiz.question: What will you learn from this guide?
options: How to cook a perfect steak
Your rights and responsibilities under the Building Award
quiz.explanation: This guide will help you understand your rights and responsibilities under the Building and Construction Award.

sections.title: What is the Building Award?
sections.content: The Building and Construction Award is your essential guide to fair work conditions in the construction industry. It sets the minimum standards for pay, work hours, breaks, and other important employment conditions.

quiz.question: What does the Building Award set?
quiz.explanation: The Award sets minimum standards for pay, hours, breaks, and other working conditions.

sections.title: Who Does the Award Cover?
sections.content: This award applies to most workers in the building, engineering, and civil construction industry. Whether you're a tradesperson, laborer, or specialist, understanding your coverage is crucial.

quiz.question: Which workers are covered by this award?
quiz.explanation: The award covers most workers in the building, engineering, and civil construction industry.

sections.title: Types of Employment
sections.content: The award recognizes different types of employment to suit various work arrangements. Each type comes with specific entitlements and conditions.

quiz.question: How many hours per week is considered full-time?
quiz.explanation: Under the award, full-time employment is 38 hours per week.

sections.title: Classification Levels
sections.content: Your classification level determines your pay rate and reflects your skills, qualifications, and responsibilities. Understanding these levels helps you track your career progression.
key_points: Level 1: New entrants and basic skills

quiz.question: What do classification levels determine?
options: Your pay rate and skill recognition
quiz.explanation: Classification levels determine your pay rate and reflect your skills, qualifications, and responsibilities.

sections.title: Common Allowances
sections.content: Allowances provide additional payment for specific working conditions, skills, or responsibilities. These are important extras on top of your base pay.
key_points: Tool allowance for your own equipment

quiz.question: What are allowances?
options: Additional payments for specific conditions or skills
quiz.explanation: Allowances are additional payments for specific working conditions, skills, or responsibilities.

sections.title: Working Hours and Breaks
sections.content: The award sets clear rules about working hours, overtime, and break entitlements to ensure safe and fair working conditions for everyone.

quiz.question: When do overtime rates apply?
quiz.explanation: Overtime rates apply after you've worked your standard hours (38 hours per week).

sections.title: What's Next?
sections.content: Now that you understand the basics, you can use our other tools to manage classifications, calculate allowances, and create compliant job posts.

quiz.question: What tools are available to help you?
options: Classification, allowances, and job posting tools
quiz.explanation: You can use our Classification tool, Allowances calculator, and Job Post creator to help manage your employment needs.
